intro: Aotus villosa var. subspinescens, commonly known as the hairy vine, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. Its botanical features make it a notable species within the Malvaceae family.
